feed.title: Sming
feed.subtitle: Sming - Open Source framework for high efficiency native ESP8266 development

entry.title: Help us test Sming and win a reward

link.title: Help us test Sming and win a reward

entry.content:
In preparation for the next version we are trying to make sure that all samples in the latest version of Sming are working as expected. We have already checked some of them on a real ESP8266 device, but there are still a lot of samples that are not tested. If you help us test them, report issues with the samples or even fix broken samples you will be eligible for a reward. The reward this time is naming the next version of Sming based on your nick name. If, for example, your nick name is avr10 our next version can be names like avrius tenius :).

The list of samples is here and those that have :question: in their status should be tested.

Good luck and hopefully with your help we will be able to release a great new version of Sming before X-Mas.
entry.summary: In preparation for the next version we are trying to make sure that all samples in the latest version of Sming are working as expected. We have already checked some of them on a real ESP8266 device, but there are still a lot of samples that are not tested. If you help us test them, report issues with the samples or even fix broken samples you will be eligible for a reward. The reward this time is naming the next version of Sming based on your nick name. If, for example, your nick name is avr10 our next version can be names like avrius tenius :).

entry.title: Logo needed
entry.content: We are looking for a logo for the Sming project. If you have suggestions make sure to attach them as a comment to this ticket.
entry.summary: We are looking for a logo for the Sming project. If you have suggestions make sure to attach them as a comment to this ticket.
